intro: Mollinedia loxocarya, commonly known as the silverleaf mollinedia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Mollinedia loxocarya is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
